servers.name: Azure MCP
servers.description: All Azure MCP tools in a single server. The Azure MCP Server implements the MCP specification to create a seamless connection between AI agents and Azure services. Azure MCP Server can be used alone or with the GitHub Copilot for Azure extension in VS Code.

servers.name: Azure AI Foundry
servers.description: A Model Context Protocol server for Azure AI Foundry, providing a unified set of tools for models, knowledge, evaluation, and more.

servers.name: Azure DevOps
servers.description: This TypeScript project provides a local MCP server for Azure DevOps, enabling you to perform a wide range of Azure DevOps tasks directly from your code editor.

servers.name: Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS)
servers.description: An MCP server that enables AI assistants to interact with Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) clusters. It serves as a bridge between AI tools and AKS, translating natural language requests into AKS operations and returning the results in a format the AI tools can understand.

servers.name: GitHub
servers.description: Access GitHub repositories, issues, and pull requests through secure API integration.

servers.name: Markitdown
servers.description: A specialized MCP server for Markdown processing and manipulation. Enables AI models to read, write, and transform Markdown content with robust parsing and formatting capabilities.

servers.name: Microsoft 365 Agents Toolkit
servers.description: The Microsoft 365 Agents Toolkit MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides a seamless connection between AI agents and developers for building apps and agents for Microsoft 365 and Microsoft 365 Copilot.

servers.name: Microsoft Clarity
servers.description: This is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for the Microsoft Clarity data export API. It allows you to fetch analytics data from Clarity using Claude for Desktop or other MCP-compatible clients.

servers.name: Microsoft Dataverse
servers.description: Chat over your business data using NL - Discover tables, run queries, retrieve data, insert or update records, and execute custom prompts grounded in business knowledge and context.

servers.name: Microsoft Dev Box
servers.description: An MCP server for Microsoft Dev Box. Enables natural language interactions for developer-focused operations like managing Dev Boxes, configuring environments, and handling pools.

servers.name: Microsoft Files
servers.description: Provides a declarative control plane for managing file-based resources, supporting AI workflows that involve static files and documentation synchronization.

servers.name: Microsoft Fabric Real-Time Intelligence
servers.description: This server enables AI agents to interact with Fabric RTI services by providing tools through the MCP interface, allowing for seamless data querying and analysis capabilities.

servers.name: Microsoft Learn
servers.description: AI assistant with real-time access to official Microsoft documentation.

servers.name: Microsoft SQL
servers.description: Chat with your business data the new agentic way using natural language and AI. Discover and define table schemas, manage tables, and perform CRUD operations through conversational prompts.

servers.name: Playwright
servers.description: This server enables LLMs to interact with web pages through structured accessibility snapshots, bypassing the need for screenshots or visually-tuned models.
